page.title: 19CROP SPRAYING
page.content: ALTHOUGH AWARE OF SOME PUBLIC CONCERN FARMERS FEEL THEY NEED SPRAYS TO INCREASE THE YIELD AND MAINTAIN THE QUALITY OF CROPS. BLACK GRASS, WILD OATS AND BROAD LEAVED WEEDS ARE ALL KILLED WITH HERBICIDES. SOME OF THE MAIN CHEMICALS USED ARE CHLORTOURON AND SOPROTURON. THERE ARE SPRAYED ON MOST CROPS TO KILL BLACK GRASS. FERTILISER IS APPLIED TO CROPS TO INCREASE THE YIELD. FERTILISER CAN BE SPRAYED ON CROPS OR PUT ON BY SPREADING MACHINE. SOME FERTILISER CHEMICALS ARE PHOSPHATE AND POTASH.THE MAIN PESTS THAT HARM CROPS ARE FLIES, APHIDS AND SLUGS. THESE ARE ALL KILLED WITH PESTICIDES. WHEN GRAIN IS STORED CHEMICALS ARE STILL USED IF THE GRAIN HAS PESTS IN IT. SOME STORED GRAIN PESTS ARE THE SAW-TOOTHED GRAIN BEETLE, THE GRAIN WEEVIL AND THE GRAIN MITE.
